def.dt: :an outer piece of clothing that can be long or short and that is worn to keep warm or dry She put on her coat, hat, and gloves, and then she went outside. a winter/fur/wool coat
:a piece of clothing that is worn over a shirt as part of a suit :jacket He was wearing a coat and tie. a sport coat
:the outer covering of fur, hair, or wool on an animal The dog has a thick/smooth/shaggy coat.
:a thin layer of paint covering a surface a coat of paint The house needed three coats to cover the original paint.
:to cover (something or someone) with a thin layer of something Rock dust coated his hair. My shoes are coated with mud. Ice coated the deck. Coat the chicken with flour.
:a device that is used for hanging clothes in a closet :hanger
:a special group of pictures that belong to a person, family, or group of people and that are shown on a shield
:a long coat worn by men especially in the 19th century
:a type of formal black coat worn by men with some suits The groom wore a morning coat.
:a man's coat that is like the top part of a suit but is less formal called also sports coat sports jacket (US) sport jacket see color picture on page C15
:a usually long raincoat with deep pockets and a belt
